data.name: @identity
data.description:
The identity decorator is a decorator that returns the same function that was passed in to it.

Implement the identity decorator again, but this time, you must return a new function (you cannot return the function that was passed in). The behavior of the decorated function must be the same as before. Your decorator must be well-behaved, i.e. the returned function must have the same name and docstring as the original, and must be able to handle the same arguments.

Here's an example :

```python
def multiply(a, b=1):
  """Calculates the product of a and b."""
  return a * b
  
multiply = identity(multiply)

print(multiply(1)) # Prints 1
```
